messages.content: Permissions on the app are visible in the block explorer link
In the frontend, there are no errors, it happily submits the tx
Bumping!
is deposit a `@method`?
or is it supposed to be one?

Hey Trivio.  Yeah it is.  I can share the typescript code as well.  I wrote here what is in my ui's node modules in order to cut out the middleman, but then the `Reflect` stuff is done elsewhere in the file...
FWIW, this passes testing with proofs on, and works in the UI against Mina.local with proof on.

The account `player` is not a zkapp, and the account `this.address` obviously is.  The receive permissions are set to `None` but were not set explicitly by me, that must just be the default.  In searching other examples of this message, setting the receive permission on the zkapp to `None` was the fix.  But other seemed to be failing tests.  This passes tests and only fails on Berkeley AFAIK
https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/wallet/B62qjb2oGVMGiPad6GKTBh6MqgFJ3ExhkfegBuUiynLoyCSbTfM62vW
can you send me the entire src code so I can take a look?

https://github.com/pico-labs/coinflip-executor-contract

Sorry it's not well documented yet.  Let me commit my example script too so you can run that.

messages.content: I will try that and report back, but wouldn't that trigger a test to fail?

Gregor responded on the github issue with the same fix. I didn't get a chance to redploy last night.  I was trying to deploy over my existing contract which I still haven't figured out, and the blocks were coming really slowly while I was testing.
I'll deploy sometime today and I guess it should work.
Woohoo! Fix confirmed, thanks @Florian!
